messages.subject: This forum.... some people's forums.... :-)
messages.msgSnippet: The same life can be seen from many different angles. The same situation can be seen while holding one s breath and being furious, or while seeing the
messages.messageBody:
"The same life can be seen from many different angles. The same situation can be seen while holding one's breath and being furious, or while seeing the alternatives and finding ways to be grateful, no matter how small, because on one small bit of gratitude, one can step up and see another one, and another."

That quote (my writing) came up in my memories. Marta Venturini had shared it on facebook in 2012.

I went to Just Add Light to see if I had already used it. I had, twice. Good.

I had saved it on a webpage on my site; good.

I came to the forum to see what year I originally wrote it. It gives a date and time, Aug. 3 3:11 pm. No year. I can’t find a way to get the page to give me a year.
https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/AlwaysLearning/conversations/messages/56609
(In case someone knows a facebook trick about where the year is hidden…)

I’ve always loved having the archives because I could find topics to mine to add to my pags, or find older discussions to read or share again. Without the year, a quote can’t be properly cited, or put into context.

It was 2011 or earlier, because…
https://justaddlightandstir.blogspot.com/2011/09/step-right-up.html

I quoted in in 2016, so I won’t use it again tomorrow, I guess…
This photo is cool. It’s from Lebanon, from an old fortress, looking out into Syria. Unschoolers live lots of places.
https://justaddlightandstir.blogspot.com/2016/02/step-up-and-see.html

While we’re examining the ruined fortress of Always Learning… my ability to cite a quote with a date may have crumbled away.

Sandra
